intro: Eriocaulon singulare, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spikerush, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, typical of the Cyperaceae family. It is often found in wet or moist habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Eriocaulon singulare is typically short-lived and plays a minor role in the ecological dynamics of its wetland environment.
